camera_x_rays.documentation: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems)

camera_x_rays.aperture.documentation: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic

camera_x_rays.aperture.centre.documentation: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

camera_x_rays.aperture.centre.phi.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)

camera_x_rays.aperture.centre.phi_error_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "phi"

camera_x_rays.aperture.centre.r_error_in.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "r"

camera_x_rays.aperture.centre.z_error_in.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

camera_x_rays.aperture.geometry_type.documentation: Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular', 3:'rectangle'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. Note that there is some flexibility here and the data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the object, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.  In case of 'rectangle', the surface is a rectangle defined by its centre, widths in the X1 and X2 directions, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.

camera_x_rays.aperture.outline.documentation: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system. Do NOT repeat the first point.

camera_x_rays.aperture.outline.x1_error_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x1"

camera_x_rays.aperture.outline.x2_error_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x2"

camera_x_rays.aperture.radius.documentation: Radius of the circle, used only if geometry_type = 2

camera_x_rays.aperture.radius_error_inde.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "radius"

camera_x_rays.aperture.surface.documentation: Surface of the detector/aperture, derived from the above geometric data

camera_x_rays.aperture.surface_error_ind.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "surface"

camera_x_rays.aperture.x1_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).

camera_x_rays.aperture.x1_unit_vector.x_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x"

camera_x_rays.aperture.x1_unit_vector.y_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "y"

camera_x_rays.aperture.x1_unit_vector.z_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

camera_x_rays.aperture.x1_width.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X1 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3

camera_x_rays.aperture.x1_width_error_in.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x1_width"

camera_x_rays.aperture.x2_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.

camera_x_rays.aperture.x2_unit_vector.x_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x"

camera_x_rays.aperture.x2_unit_vector.y_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "y"

camera_x_rays.aperture.x2_unit_vector.z_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

camera_x_rays.aperture.x2_width.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X2 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3

camera_x_rays.aperture.x2_width_error_in.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x2_width"

camera_x_rays.aperture.x3_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.

camera_x_rays.aperture.x3_unit_vector.x_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x"

camera_x_rays.aperture.x3_unit_vector.y_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "y"

camera_x_rays.aperture.x3_unit_vector.z_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

camera_x_rays.camera.documentation: Characteristics of the camera used. The orientation of the camera is described as follows : pixels are aligned along x1 and x2 unit vectors while x3 is normal to the detector plane.

camera_x_rays.camera.camera_dimensions.documentation: Total camera dimension in each direction (x1, x2)

camera_x_rays.camera.camera_dimensions_e.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "camera_dimensions"

camera_x_rays.camera.centre.phi.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)

camera_x_rays.camera.centre.phi_error_in.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "phi"

camera_x_rays.camera.centre.r_error_inde.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "r"

camera_x_rays.camera.centre.z_error_inde.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

camera_x_rays.camera.line_of_sight.documentation: Description of the line of sight for each pixel, given by 2 points. For each coordinate : first dimension : line index (x1 axis); second dimension: column index (x2 axis).

camera_x_rays.camera.line_of_sight.first.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

camera_x_rays.camera.line_of_sight.secon.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

camera_x_rays.camera.pixel_dimensions.documentation: Pixel dimension in each direction (x1, x2)

camera_x_rays.camera.pixel_dimensions_er.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "pixel_dimensions"

camera_x_rays.camera.pixel_position.documentation: Position of the centre of each pixel. First dimension : line index (x1 axis). Second dimension: column index (x2 axis).

camera_x_rays.camera.pixel_position.phi.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)

camera_x_rays.camera.pixel_position.phi_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "phi"

camera_x_rays.camera.pixel_position.r_er.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "r"

camera_x_rays.camera.pixel_position.z_er.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

camera_x_rays.camera.pixels_n.documentation: Number of pixels in each direction (x1, x2)

camera_x_rays.camera.x1_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).

camera_x_rays.camera.x1_unit_vector.x_er.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x"

camera_x_rays.camera.x1_unit_vector.y_er.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "y"

camera_x_rays.camera.x1_unit_vector.z_er.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

camera_x_rays.camera.x2_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.

camera_x_rays.camera.x2_unit_vector.x_er.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x"

camera_x_rays.camera.x2_unit_vector.y_er.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "y"

camera_x_rays.camera.x2_unit_vector.z_er.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

camera_x_rays.camera.x3_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the camera plane and oriented towards the plasma.

camera_x_rays.camera.x3_unit_vector.x_er.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x"

camera_x_rays.camera.x3_unit_vector.y_er.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "y"

camera_x_rays.camera.x3_unit_vector.z_er.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

camera_x_rays.code.documentation: Generic decription of the code-specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

camera_x_rays.code.library.documentation: List of external libraries used by the code that has produced this IDS

camera_x_rays.code.library[:].parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

camera_x_rays.code.output_flag.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

camera_x_rays.code.parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

camera_x_rays.detector_humidity.documentation: Fraction of humidity (0-1) measured at the detector level

camera_x_rays.detector_humidity.data_err.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

camera_x_rays.detector_temperature.documentation: Temperature measured at the detector level

camera_x_rays.detector_temperature.data_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

camera_x_rays.energy_configuration_name.documentation: Name of the chosen energy configuration (energy detection threshold)

camera_x_rays.energy_threshold_lower.documentation: Lower energy detection threshold on each pixel of the detector (photons are counted only if their energy is above this value)

camera_x_rays.energy_threshold_lower_err.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "energy_threshold_lower"

camera_x_rays.exposure_time_error_index.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "exposure_time"

camera_x_rays.filter_window.centre.documentation: Coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the filter. This origin is located within the filter area and should be the middle point of the filter surface. If geometry_type=2, it's the centre of the circular filter. If geometry_type=3, it's the centre of the rectangular filter.

camera_x_rays.filter_window.centre.phi.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)

camera_x_rays.filter_window.centre.phi_e.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "phi"

camera_x_rays.filter_window.centre.r_err.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "r"

camera_x_rays.filter_window.centre.z_err.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

camera_x_rays.filter_window.curvature_ty.documentation:
Curvature of the filter.
1) planar : Planar object, no curvature
2) cylindrical_x1 : Cylindrical in the X1 direction, use x1_curvature
3) cylindrical_x2 : Cylindrical in the X2 direction, use x2_curvature
4) spherical : Spherical : same curvature radius in X1 and X2 directions, indicated in x1_curvature
5) toroidal : Toroidal : x1_curvature in X1 direction and x2_curvature in X2 direction
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

camera_x_rays.filter_window.geometry_typ.documentation:
Geometry of the filter contour. Note that there is some flexibility in the choice of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3). The data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the filter, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below.
1) polygonal : Contour described by a polygonal outline in the (X1, X2) plane
2) circular : Circle in the (X1, X2) plane, defined by its centre and radius
3) rectangle : Rectangle in the (X1, X2) plane, defined by its centre and widths in the X1 and X2 directions
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

camera_x_rays.filter_window.material.documentation:
Material of the filter window
0) unspecified : unspecified
1) C : Carbon
2) W : Tungsten
3) C_W_coating : Carbon with tungsten coating
4) SS : Stainless steel
5) SS_C_coating : Stainless steel with carbon coating
6) IN : Inconel
7) IN_C_coating : Inconel with carbon coating
8) B_C : Boron carbide
9) Ti_C_coating : Titanium with carbon coating
10) Be : Beryllium
11) Mo : Molybdenum
12) Quartz : Quartz
13) Ge : Germanium
14) Si : Silicon
15) LiF : Lithium fluoride
16) InSb : Indium antimonide

camera_x_rays.filter_window.material.ind.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

camera_x_rays.filter_window.outline.documentation: Irregular outline of the filter in the (X1, X2) coordinate system, used only if geometry_type/index=1. Do NOT repeat the first point.

camera_x_rays.filter_window.outline.x1_e.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x1"

camera_x_rays.filter_window.outline.x2_e.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x2"

camera_x_rays.filter_window.photon_absor.documentation: Probability of absorbing a photon passing through the filter as a function of its wavelength
Index in the error_description list for "photon_absorption"

camera_x_rays.filter_window.radius.documentation: Radius of the circle, used only if geometry_type/index = 2

camera_x_rays.filter_window.radius_error.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "radius"

camera_x_rays.filter_window.surface.documentation: Surface of the filter, derived from the above geometric data

camera_x_rays.filter_window.surface_erro.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "surface"

camera_x_rays.filter_window.thickness_er.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "thickness"

camera_x_rays.filter_window.wavelength_l.documentation: Lower bound of the filter wavelength range
Index in the error_description list for "wavelength_lower"

camera_x_rays.filter_window.wavelength_u.documentation: Upper bound of the filter wavelength range
Index in the error_description list for "wavelength_upper"

camera_x_rays.filter_window.wavelengths_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "wavelengths"

camera_x_rays.filter_window.x1_curvature.documentation: Radius of curvature in the X1 direction, to be filled only for curvature_type/index = 2, 4 or 5
Index in the error_description list for "x1_curvature"

camera_x_rays.filter_window.x1_unit_vect.documentation: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

camera_x_rays.filter_window.x1_width.documentation: Full width of the filter in the X1 direction, used only if geometry_type/index = 3

camera_x_rays.filter_window.x1_width_err.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x1_width"

camera_x_rays.filter_window.x2_curvature.documentation: Radius of curvature in the X2 direction, to be filled only for curvature_type/index = 3 or 5
Index in the error_description list for "x2_curvature"

camera_x_rays.filter_window.x2_unit_vect.documentation: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

camera_x_rays.filter_window.x2_width.documentation: Full width of the filter in the X2 direction, used only if geometry_type/index = 3

camera_x_rays.filter_window.x2_width_err.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x2_width"

camera_x_rays.filter_window.x3_unit_vect.documentation: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the filter surface and oriented towards the plasma.
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

camera_x_rays.frame.documentation: Set of frames. Each time step corresponds to the beginning of the photon integration of each image

camera_x_rays.frame[:].counts_n.documentation: Number of counts detected on each pixel during one exposure time. First dimension : line index (horizontal axis). Second dimension: column index (vertical axis).

camera_x_rays.ids_properties.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

camera_x_rays.ids_properties.comment.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

camera_x_rays.ids_properties.creation_da.documentation: Date at which this data has been produced

camera_x_rays.ids_properties.homogeneous.documentation: This node must be filled (with 0, 1, or 2) for the IDS to be valid. If 1, the time of this IDS is homogeneous, i.e. the time values for this IDS are stored in the time node just below the root of this IDS. If 0, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree. In the case only constant or static nodes are filled within the IDS, homogeneous_time must be set to 2

camera_x_rays.ids_properties.occurrence.description: occurrence number [NOTE: this field only exists in OMAS and is not part of the ITER PDM]

camera_x_rays.ids_properties.provenance..documentation: Set of IDS nodes for which the provenance is given. The provenance information applies to the whole structure below the IDS node. For documenting provenance information for the whole IDS, set the size of this array of structure to 1 and leave the child "path" node empty
Path of the node within the IDS, following the syntax given in the link below. If empty, means the provenance information applies to the whole IDS.

List of sources used to import or calculate this node, identified as explained below. In case the node is the result of of a calculation / data processing, the source is an input to the process described in the "code" structure at the root of the IDS. The source can be an IDS (identified by a URI or a persitent identifier, see syntax in the link below) or non-IDS data imported directly from an non-IMAS database (identified by the command used to import the source, or the persistent identifier of the data source). Often data are obtained by a chain of processes, however only the last process input are recorded here. The full chain of provenance has then to be reconstructed recursively from the provenance information contained in the data sources.

camera_x_rays.ids_properties.provider.documentation: Name of the person in charge of producing this data

camera_x_rays.ids_properties.source.documentation: Source of the data (any comment describing the origin of the data : code, path to diagnostic signals, processing method, ...). Superseeded by the new provenance structure.

camera_x_rays.ids_properties.version_put.documentation: Version of the access layer package used to PUT this IDS
Version of Access Layer used to PUT this IDS
Programming language of the Access Layer high level API used to PUT this IDS
Version of Data Dictionary used to PUT this IDS

camera_x_rays.latency.documentation: Upper bound of the delay between physical information received by the detector and data available on the real-time (RT) network.

camera_x_rays.latency_error_index.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "latency"

camera_x_rays.photon_energy.documentation: List of values of the photon energy (coordinate for quantum_effiency)

camera_x_rays.photon_energy_error_index.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "photon_energy"

camera_x_rays.pixel_status.documentation: Status of each pixel : +1 for valid pixels, -1 for inactive pixels, -2 for mis-calibrated pixels.

camera_x_rays.quantum_efficiency.documentation: Quantum efficiency of the detector, i.e. conversion factor multiplying the number of counts to obtain the number of photons impacting the detector, tabulated as a function of the photon energy, for each pixel of the detector. If all pixels have the same quantum efficiency, just set the size of the first and second dimensions to 1

camera_x_rays.quantum_efficiency_error_i.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "quantum_efficiency"

camera_x_rays.readout_time.documentation: Time used to read out each frame on the detector

camera_x_rays.readout_time_error_index.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "readout_time"
